item.value: 檢驗是否在兩個設定之間
Scan the QR code to access the Must-Read articles on system design. These articles have helped three engineers successfully pass system design interviews and secure positions at Meta!

Identifying an Engineering-Friendly Work Environment 1. Decision Making How do you measure the success of a goal, in terms of business and technology? Is data-driven analysis or subjective intuition more influential in decision-making? 2. Engineering Efficiency What is the timeline from code commit to public release? What are the necessary steps involved in the release process for backend, frontend, and mobile development? 3. Balancing Business Goals and Technical Debt How do you reach a balance between business objectives and managing technical debt? How would you prioritize these goals in the event of resource conflicts
Ability to ask (good) questions. ● Address on solving problems systematically. ● Providing constructive feedback. ● Be respectful but straightforward

I wish I had known these things earlier… ● Work culture is WAY MORE important than I thought. ○ 5 out of 10 my colleagues in RECO team at Zalando was hired by Meta or Google. (at position IC4, IC5, and IC6) ● I wish I were younger. ● Learn English

You must be exceptional on coding, system design and behaviours, as you are collaborating with a highly skilled group of software engineers, collectively regarded as some of the finest in the industry. You tackle the most complex problems on a global scale, continuously pushing the boundaries of software engineering
The most important thing is: The way of working and thinking is shaped by your colleagues and boss; in other words, by the work culture you are in. …at least 8 hours a day
The most important thing is: The way of working and thinking is shaped by your colleagues and boss; in other words, by the work culture you are in. …at least 8 hours a daa
The most important thing is: The way of working and thinking is shaped by your colleagues and boss; in other words, by the work culture you are in. …at least 8 hours a da
I wish I had known these things earlier… ● Your time is not solely yours. ● Stay away from excessive video/computer games (and your excessive smartphone usage). ● Fundamentals ● Learn English ● And…
